EmailTemplate.name: RE: MBO Call Follow Up (1335286993.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: MBO Call Follow Up (1335286993.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - - 90 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Macon, Thank you so much for sending this over. Is this something they want you to sign or MBO to sign? Usually our consultants sign this document as they are the ones privy to the material that the client doesn’t want disclosed. Just let me know. I am excited to review the standard contract terms to let you know if MBO could work within them. Yes, if we review the agreement and are able to execute it this would enable others to use MBO with this client as well. Thanks Macon,Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com> Macon Morrison [mailto:macon.morrison@gmail.com] Sent: Monday, April 23, 2012 4:26 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Call Follow Up Hi Sara, Thank you for preparing the additional calculations. Attached is NII's NDA. Once I have signed NDA, my NII manager indicated that I may share with you the standard contract terms used by consulting firms as well as by SoloW2 for your internal review and approval process. You mentioned that you work with individuals; are you also able to work with corporations to become an approved "preferred vendor"? This would theoretically enable others to also choose between MBO or SoloW2. Regards, Macon On Wed, Apr 18, 2012 at 6:09 PM, Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>> wrote:Hi Macon, Ok I got it, sorry for the confusion. Please see attached. Thanks!Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Macon Morrison [mailto:macon.morrison@gmail.com <tel:703.793.6028>] Sent: Tuesday, April 17, 2012 2:40 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Call Follow Up Hi Sara, Sorry I'm just not following yet. :-) If We put in 65% instead of 80%, does that calculate less retirement? I need at least $5000 in net post-retirement cash income. Thanks!
Sent from my iPhone On Apr 17, 2012, at 2:01 PM, Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com> wrote:Hi Macon, I am so sorry of the delayed response this email, I had accidently marked it as answered! 50% is the maximum amount you can put in the employee deferral line…anything 50% or over will automatically max out your 401k. Don’t think about it in terms of what percent is match what is deferral etc. Just let me know the total % that you would like to show going to 401(k) and I will do the math on my end to have that display on the estimate Thanks!Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: macon.morrison@gmail.com [mailto:macon.morrison@gmail.com] <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCdlBaukk45vOLMKD%2BkDvgfZWpsrAzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> On Behalf Of Macon Morrison Sent: Friday, April 13, 2012 4:30 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Call Follow Up Gotcha. It looks like it was originally at 80% (50% + 30% match). Let's put it at 65% (50% + 15% match). Thanks! Macon On Fri, Apr 13, 2012 at 3:51 PM, Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com> wrote:Hi Macon, I am sorry I misunderstood. The 401(k) estimation tool doesn’t work that way, you need to let me know the total percentage you would like to be contributed and then I will do the math to find out what the employee deferral will need to be so the match and the deferral equal add up to that total percentage. I cannot use the tool based on the dollar amount contribution. Sorry for the inconvenience, Thanks!Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: macon.morrison@gmail.com [mailto:macon.morrison@gmail.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCdlBaukk45vOLMKD%2BkDvge5S9trJ0R%2BLo0YE73V0UGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCdlBaukk45vOLMKD%2BkDvgfZWpsrAzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D>] On Behalf Of Macon Morrison Sent: Friday, April 13, 2012 3:45 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Call Follow Up Thanks... Sorry, I'd like to keep the full 401K self contribution at 17K, but just change the match part to 15% from the business center portion (the match was originally at 30%). MaconOn Fri, Apr 13, 2012 at 3:38 PM, Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCdlBaukk45vOLMKD%2BkDvge5S9trJ0R%2BLo0YE73V0UGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCdlBaukk45vOLMKD%2BkDvgfZWpsrAzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D>> wrote:Sure thing – please see updates attached. Thanks!Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: macon.morrison@gmail.com [mailto:macon.morrison@gmail.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&tel:703.793.6028?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCdlBaukk45vOLMKD%2BkDvge5S9trJ0R%2BLo0YE73V0UGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCdlBaukk45vOLMKD%2BkDvgfZWpsrAzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D>] On Behalf Of Macon Morrison Sent: Friday, April 13, 2012 3:25 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Call Follow Up Hi Sara, Thanks for this! Is there any way to lower the non-billables to $200 (I can walk to work) and lower the retirement match to 15% (currently at 30%)? Thanks! Macon On Fri, Apr 13, 2012 at 3:11 PM, Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com> wrote:Dear Macon , It was a pleasure speaking with you. You’ll find everything that I referenced on our call by going here. I have also attached the estimates we created together. We are also promoting our new meet the independents project and are taking applications if you would like to be featured. You can view the program by going here. I will follow up with you as promised, should you have questions before then, please schedule a convenient time using my online schedule. Best regards,Sara___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed.
